exm.mng: cheating neither old nor young (idiom); treating youngsters and old folk equally scrupulously, Our house offers sincere treatment to all and fair trade to old and young alike.

lit. the old man lost his horse, but it all turned out for the best (idiom), fig. a blessing in disguise, it's an ill wind that blows nobody any good
